title: Titration of HA - conjugate acid base

content.description:
A <math alttext="10.0 milliliter" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.0</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of an unknown acid, <math alttext="H A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, is titrated with <math alttext="0.20 molar N a O H aqueous" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. The reaction that occurs during the titration is represented by the following equation.

<math alttext="H A aqueous plus O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous, react to produce H 2 O liquid plus A with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>HA</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>OH</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>l</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>A</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

The following titration curve is produced.
content.question: Which of the following is a conjugate acid-base pair for the reaction that occurs during the titration?

choices.label: <math alttext="H A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>HA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>OH</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="H A " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="A with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>A</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>OH</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

content.answer: <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>OH</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
